School Lunch Hero Day!
Pilot Point ISD’s school nutrition staff strive to make lunchtime the favorite part of every student’s day. From their friendly greetings in the cafeteria and the love they serve with every student’s meal, to how they encourage kids to eat more fruits and vegetables, school nutrition professionals are true heroes. Since the beginning of the nation’s Coronavirus health crisis, Aramark’s nutrition staff have safely delivered more than 18.2 free meals to students, and continue to deliver one million meals daily.

In honor of School Lunch Heroes Day (May 1), Pilot Point ISD is honoring the people who have stepped up to feed students during this unprecedented time, by inviting students and families to show their appreciation for their school nutrition staff when they pick up their meals.

Pilot Point Food Service Announcement:
Effective on Tuesday, April 21, 2020

Our mission in Child Nutrition is to make sure all students are fed healthy meals. With the safety of our students and staff in mind, we have a minor adjustment to our meal service. We want to make this as easy and convenient for all parents and students. We will continue the curbside pickup of 3 meals per student, but are now able to provide meals for students not present at the time of pickup.

New Rules from the Texas Department of Agriculture require that parents picking up free meals for children– WITHOUT THE CHILDREN PRESENT– MUST SHOW DOCUMENTATION FOR THE CHILDREN THAT THE MEALS ARE FOR.
Acceptable documentation includes:
• School Issued student ID card
• Report Card
• Birth Certificate
• Or other documentation from the School

The meal service dates and times are:
Monday—Friday: April 20th-May 22nd
10 am– 11:30 am

Our locations will remain the same.
♦ Pilot Point Intermediate School (Bus drop area in back)
♦ Pioneer Baptist Church (Drive thru awning)

We are pleased to invite you to join your community in raising money for Pilot Point Schools at an event that is sure to cause some excitement – Drive 4 UR School!

For every person who takes a test-drive in a Ford vehicle during our event, Ford Motor Company will donate $20 to Pilot Point ISD. In total, as much as $6000 could be raised!

By taking a simple, free test-drive, you can support this program and help your school in a meaningful way!

Please mark your calendars and invite family, friends and neighbors to join in supporting Pilot Point Schools and your local community! Be certain to tell your rep that you are there to support PPISD in the Drive 4 UR School program.

The Pilot Point Independent School District’s Board of Trustees voted to call a bond election to be approved by the voters of Pilot Point on May 7, 2016. The bond package was developed and recommended by the district’s Long Range Facilities Planning Committee, which represented a diverse cross section of the community including parents, business leaders, teachers, district administrators and community leaders.

The bond, totaling $13.65 million, will address educational program expansion, extracurricular facilities improvements, and land for future district growth. If approved by voters, the bond will allow for the renovation and expansion of the High School Band Hall and Career & Technology Education facilities to accommodate program capacity and evolving curriculum needs. Additionally, the bond will provide for the construction of a district-owned competition Baseball and Softball Complex, and upgrades to Massey Stadium and Football Field.

Please visit www.PPISDBond.com for more information!

post_text: Congratulations to Mrs. Angie Price for being voted the HS paraprofessional of the year! #ppisdproud
shared_text:
Pilot Point High School, Texas
June 3, 2015 at 11:03 AM ·

Angie Price is my right arm. Angie Price is Coach Best’s right arm. Angie Price is everyone’s right arm! We could not function without her, and that’s why she has been voted upon by her peers as Paraprofessional of the Year for the 2014-2015 school year.

Mrs. Price does it all, and she does it so well—and she always does it with a smile on her face! She is incredibly professional, organized, cool, calm, and collected. Whenever everything may be going wrong, Mrs. Price is talking about what’s going right. If there’s something that needs to be done, she’ll do it without hesitation—and it’s always done right. There’s no question in anyone’s mind that she is a tremendous asset to everyone on this campus, administrators, teachers, and kids alike. All you need to know about Angie Price is this: she makes this a better place, and none of us know what we would do without her.

Congratulations, Mrs. Price, and thank you for all that you do!

post_text: Congratulations to Math Teacher Kandis Milner for being voted HS Teacher of the Year! #ppisdproud
shared_text:
Pilot Point High School, Texas
June 3, 2015 at 11:04 AM ·

Kandis Milner is our Teacher of the Year for the 2014-2015 school year. Mrs. Milner is one of the most respected teachers on our campus. Her genuine love for kids and for teaching is seen each and every single day. This year, we created a “brag box” where PPHS faculty and staff members would write something down positive about a teacher, office staff member, or aide. It never failed that each time I opened up the box, someone on this campus was saying something positive about her. Everyone knows what kind of teacher she is. She teaches hard bell to bell. She gets after kids (although she’s very sweet about it). She’s always working with kids, always worrying about kids—and that’s why they love her. They know she cares.

We are incredibly fortunate to have someone of her talents in a classroom because she truly does make a difference. Simply put: she is a remarkable teacher.

Congratulations, Mrs. Milner!
